clinical_study.brief_title: MELT - MRI Evaluation of Lymphoma Treatment
clinical_study.official_title: Whole Body Functional and Anatomical MRI: Accuracy in Staging and Treatment Response Monitoring in Adolescent Hodgkin's Lymphoma Compared to Conventional Multimodality Imaging

brief_summary.textblock: Patients who are newly diagnosed with Hodgkin's lymphoma will undergo disease staging at diagnosis and initial treatment response assessment. At each time point (initial staging and treatment response assessment) in addition to standard imaging investigations (PET CT, Chest CT, anatomical MRI of the abdomen and pelvis and abdominal USS), patients will undergo an extended MRI scan.

detailed_description.textblock: The trial will be a single centre cohort study in patients newly diagnosed with Hodgkin's lymphoma undergoing disease staging at diagnosis and initial treatment response assessment. At each time point (initial staging and treatment response assessment) in addition to standard imaging investigations (PET CT, Chest CT, anatomical MRI of the abdomen and pelvis and abdominal USS), patients will undergo advanced anatomical and functional MRI sequences.

primary_outcome.measure: The per site sensitivity and specificity of MRI for both nodal and extranodal sites and concordance in final disease stage with the multi-modality reference standard
primary_outcome.time_frame: The recruited patients to be followed up for 1 year

secondary_outcome.measure: The number of correct patient classifications into therapy responders and non-responders by MRI compared to the multi modality reference
secondary_outcome.time_frame: The recruited patients to be followed up for 1 year

secondary_outcome.measure: Inter observer agreement for MRI between reporting radiologists (on site and off site). responders by MRI compared to the multi modality reference
secondary_outcome.time_frame: The recruited patients to be followed up for 1 year

secondary_outcome.measure: Sensitivity, specificity of qualitative assessment of Minimum intensity projection (MIP) inverted high B value datasets
secondary_outcome.time_frame: The recruited patients to be followed up for 1 year

secondary_outcome.measure: Utility of apparent diffusion coefficient (ADC) histogram analysis for identifying responsive nodal disease
secondary_outcome.time_frame: The recruited patients to be followed up for 1 year

secondary_outcome.measure: Simulated effect of MRI on clinical management via external oncologic review

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Aged 5 to 20 years (inclusive) with participant and parent/guardian informed consent
- Histologically confirmed first presentation of Hodgkin's Lymphoma
- Either entered into the Euronet PHL-C1 trial or LP1 trials OR not formally entered into the Euronet trials but treated on the chemotherapy regimens of the Euronet trials for classical and lymphocyte predominant Hodgkin Lymphoma
Exclusion Criteria:
- Contraindications to MRI (e.g. pacemaker)
- Previous malignancy or previous chemotherapy or radiotherapy treatment for malignancy
- Pregnancy or nursing
